column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0041] Determinations of zero-shear apparent viscosity of the cleansing compositions were conducted on a controlled-stress rheometer (AR-2000, TA Instruments Ltd., New Castle, Del., USA).
#Text=Steady-state shear stress sweeps were performed at 25.0.+-.0.1.degree.
#Text=C. using a cone-plate geometry.
#Text=Data acquisition and analysis were performed with the Rheology Advantage software v4.1.10 (TA Instruments Ltd., New Castle, Del., USA).
#Text=Zero-shear apparent viscosities for Newtonian fluids are reported as the average of viscosity values obtained over a range of shear stresses (0.02-1.0 Pa).
#Text=For pseudoplastic (shear-thinning) fluids, zero-shear apparent viscosities were calculated via the fitting of shear stress sweep data to an Ellis viscosity model.
#Text=Except otherwise stated, viscosities are given in CentiPoise (cps).
#Text=Formulation Foam Test:
#Text=[0042] The following Formulation Foam Test was performed on various cleansing compositions to determine the foam volume upon agitation according to the present invention.
#Text=First, a solution of the test composition is prepared in simulated tap water.
#Text=To represent the hardness of tap water, 0.455 g of calcium chloride dihydrate (Sigma-Aldrich) is dissolved per 1000 g of DI water, and mixed for 15 minutes prior to use.
#Text=One (1.0) or five (5.0) grams of test composition is weighed, and this solution is added to 1000 g and mixed until homogeneous for 15 minutes prior to use.

#Text=To determine the Formulation Foam Volume, the test composition (1000 mL) was added to the sample tank of a SITA R-2000 foam tester (commercially available from Future Digital Scientific, Co.; Bethpage, N.Y.).

#Text=The test parameters were set to repeat three runs (series count=3) of 250 ml sample size (fill volume=250 ml) with thirteen stir cycles (stir count=13) for a 15 second stir time per cycle (stir time=15 seconds) with the rotor spinning at 1200 RPM (revolution=1200) at a temperature setting of 30.degree.
#Text=C..+-.2.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Foam volume data was collected at the end of each stir cycle and the average and standard deviation of the three runs was determined.
#Text=The Maximum Foam Volume was reported for each Example as the value after the thirteenth stir cycle.
#Text=EpiDerm.TM.
#Text=Test:
#Text=[0043] Upon receipt of the EpiDerm.TM.
#Text=Skin Kit (MatTek Corporation), the solutions were stored as indicated by the manufacturer.
#Text=The EpiDerm.TM. tissues were stored at 2-8.degree.
#Text=C. until use.
#Text=On the day of dosing, EpiDerm.TM.
#Text=Assay Medium was warmed to approximately 37.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Nine-tenths mL of Assay Medium were aliquotted into the appropriate wells of 6-well plates.
#Text=The 6-well plates were labeled to indicate test article and exposure time.
#Text=Each EpiDerm.TM. tissue was inspected for air bubbles between the agarose gel and cell culture insert prior to opening the sealed package.
#Text=Tissues with air bubbles covering greater than 50% of the cell culture insert area were not used.
#Text=The 24-well shipping containers were removed from the plastic bag and their surfaces were disinfected with 70% ethanol.
